argument.description: The string to return the length for. It can be CHAR, VARCHAR2, NCHAR, or NVARCHAR2, but it can not be CLOB or NCLOB.

returnType: The LENGTH4 function returns a numeric value. If string1 is NULL, then the LENGTH4 function will return NULL.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL LENGTH4 function returns the length of the specified string, using UCS4 code points.
sample:
LENGTH4(NULL)
Result: NULL

LENGTH4('')
Result: NULL

LENGTH4(' ')
Result: 1

LENGTH4('TechOnTheNet.com')
Result: 16

LENGTH4('TechOnTheNet.com ')
Result: 17
